member.name: T:TraceTool.FontDetail
member.summary: Specify a font detail for traces columns items and members.

member.name: T:TraceTool.ParsedObjectList
member.summary: List of parsed object.

member.name: M:TraceTool.ParsedObjectList.GetKeyForItem(System.Object)
member.summary: This is the only method that absolutely must be overridden, because without it the KeyedCollection cannot extract the keys from the items. The input parameter type is the second generic type argument, in this case OrderItem, and the return value type is the first generic type argument, in this case int.

members.member: 2 ways to send traces : windows messages or socket messages. Under ASP, you must use Socket
Windows message
Socket message
Socket message
No messages are send (use local log)

member.summary: Change font detail for an item in the trace
member.param: Column index : All columns=-1, Col1=0, Col2=1, Col3=2
Change Color. To reduce the number assembly reference, the Color structure is not used. Use YourColor.ToArgb() instead.

member.name: M:TraceTool.TMemberNode.SetFontDetail(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Change font detail for an item in the trace
member.param: Column index : All columns=-1, Col1=0, Col2=1, Col3=2
Change Color. To reduce the number assembly reference, the Color structure is not used. Use YourColor.ToArgb() instead. Use -1 to keep default color

member.summary: Change font detail for an item in the trace
member.param: Column index : All columns=-1, Col1=0, Col2=1, Col3=2
Change Color. To reduce the number assembly reference, the Color structure is not used. Use YourColor.ToArgb() instead. Use -1 to keep default color
Change font size, use zero to keep normal size

member.name: T:TraceTool.ITracePlugin
member.summary: Plugin interface. Inherit from this interface to create a TraceTool plugin

member.name: M:TraceTool.ITracePlugin.GetPlugName
member.summary: Get the plugin name

member.name: M:TraceTool.ITracePlugin.OnAction(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Called when the user click on a button, label or menu on a WinTrace. The plugin must call WinTrace.LinkToPlugin in order to receive this event
member.param: Node id of the current selected trace (can be empty)
member.returns: when true : tracetool perform the default action when false : tracetool don't perform any action

member.name: M:TraceTool.ITracePlugin.OnBeforeDelete(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Called when a node is to be deleted on a WinTrace The plugin must call WinTrace.LinkToPlugin in order to receive this event
member.returns: when true : tracetool delete the node when false : tracetool don't delete the node

member.name: M:TraceTool.ITracePlugin.OnTimer
member.summary: Called every 500 ms. Can be used for example to refresh labels The plugin must call LinkToPlugin in order to receive this event

member.name: M:TraceTool.ITracePlugin.Start
member.summary: Initialise the plugin

member.name: M:TraceTool.ITracePlugin.Stop
member.summary: Stop the plugin

member.name: T:TraceTool.TraceNode
member.summary: TraceNode represent node on the viewer.

member.name: M:TraceTool.TraceNode.#ctor(TraceTool.TraceNode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor. Use TTrace or TraceNodeEx class as entry point Create a Node with an unique ID (true) You can also recreated an already send node if you still have the id
member.param: The parent node where to place that trace. The IconIndex and the enabled properties are also recopied Can be null : the root tree become the parent node, enabled is true and the default icon is used
When true, a unique ID (a guid) is generated for the trace.

member.name: F:TraceTool.TraceNodeBase.Id
member.summary: The unique ID. Normally it's a GUID, but can be replaced by something else for inter process traces.

member.name: F:TraceTool.TraceNodeBase.Enabled
member.summary: When Enabled is false, all traces are disabled. Default is true. All node have a Enabled property, that lets you define group of Enabled trace. For example set the TTrace.Debug.enabled to false but continue to accept Error and Warning traces

member.name: F:TraceTool.TraceNodeEx.SendObjectRecursiveStatus
member.summary: SendObjectRecursiveStatus is used to block recursive call to AddTypeObject since AddTypeObject will try to evaluate field GET method. If the GET method call AddObject or similar function, we have a possible recursive call (with stack overflow).

members.member: Display all fields (with corresponding value) of the type Called by AddValue(), not by AddObject()
Display all properties (with corresponding value, if any) of the type Called by AddValue(), not by AddObject()
show the type with its interfaces, and base classes.
show nested type names (not the content)
Display all fields (with corresponding value) of the type Called by AddObject(), not by AddValue()
caller : AddTypeObject (caller : AddType, AddObject)
Display all properties (with corresponding value, if any) of the type Called by AddObject(), not by AddValue()
display all Constructors of a type
display all Methods of a type Note that Operators are method but will be displayed in a separate group
display all Events of a type

Send a trace specifying the text for 2 columns This sample shows how to send a sample trace.
TTrace.Debug.Send ("Hello", "world") ; // 2 columns trace

member.name: T:TraceTool.TTrace
member.summary: TTrace is the entry point for all traces. TTrace give 3 'TraceNode' doors : Warning , Error and Debug. Theses 3 doors are displayed with a special icon (all of them have the 'enabled' property set to true. That class is fully static.

members.member: number of message discarded (socket error)
number of message send
TTrace Options (socket, show functions, ...)

member.summary: Show or hide the trace program
member.param: When True : Show. When False : Hide

members.member: flush remaining traces to the viewer
flush remaining traces to the viewer
Last stored time with precision up to the second.
Last stored time with precision up to the second, formatted as a string.

member.name: M:TraceTool.TTrace.FormatDateWithoutMillis(System.DateTime,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Renders the date into a string. Format is "HH:mm:ss". if Options.SendDate is true , date is added in front
member.remarks: This method will be called at most once per second and the result will be reused if it is needed again during the same second.
member.param: The date to render into a string.
The string builder to write to.

member.name: M:TraceTool.TTrace.FormatDate(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Renders the date into a string. Format is "HH:mm:ss,SSS".

remarks.para: Uses the FormatDateWithoutMillis() method to generate the time string up to the seconds and then appends the current milliseconds. The results from FormatDateWithoutMillis() are cached and FormatDateWithoutMillis() is called at most once per second.
Sub classes should override FormatDateWithoutMillis() rather than FormatDate().

member.param: The date to render into a string.

member.name: T:TraceTool.TTraceOptions
member.summary: Options for the traces.

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SendMode
member.summary: WinMsg (for desktop applications only), Socket (ASP , services, or remote computer), WebSocket (webAssembly), None (No messages are send, use local log)

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.UseWorkerThread
member.summary: Use a background thread to send traces to the viewer. Default is true. Set to false for async mode (web assembly)

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SocketHost
member.summary: The Socket Host address

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SocketPort
member.summary: The socket port

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SocketUdp
member.summary: Indicate if the socket use the Udp protocol

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SendModifiers
member.summary: indicate if the reflection should display modifiers (public class,...)

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SendClassInfo
member.summary: indicate if the reflection should display class info (assembly,guid,...) and bases classes names

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SendFields
member.summary: indicate if the reflection should display fields values

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SendCustomAttributes
member.summary: indicate if the reflection should display custom attributes

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SendNonPublic
member.summary: indicate if the reflection should display non public (private and protected) members

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SendInherited
member.summary: indicate if the reflections should display inherited members

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SendEvents
member.summary: indicate if the reflections should display the events

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SendFunctions
member.summary: indicate if the reflection should display functions

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SendDoc
member.summary: indicate if the reflection should display documentation for type, fields, methods,..

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SendPrivate
member.summary: indicate if the reflection should also display private members. Default is false

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.ObjectTreeDepth
member.summary: Max Object tree depth for SendValue and Watches

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SendTypeWithValue
member.summary: Indicate if SendValue and AddValue function should display members type. Default is true

member.name: F:TraceTool.TTraceOptions.SendProcessName
member.summary: indicate if the process name must be send. Displayed on the status bar.

member.name: T:TraceTool.WinTrace
member.summary: WinTrace represent a windows tree where you put traces

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.#ctor
member.summary: WinTrace constructor : you can map a WinTrace to an existing window Nothing is send to the viewer

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: WinTrace constructor. The Window Trace is create on the viewer (if not already done)
member.param: Required window trace Id. If empty, a guid will be generated
The Window Title on the viewer.If empty, a default name will be used

member.name: P:TraceTool.WinTrace.Warning
member.summary:
Warning, Error and Debug are the 3 doors to send traces This sample shows how to send a sample trace.
TTrace.Error.Send ("Hello", "world") ; // 2 columns TTrace.Warning.Send ("Hello") ; // 1 columns TTrace.Debug.SendObject("MyObject" , this) ; // 1 columns + members tree

member.name: P:TraceTool.WinTrace.Error
member.summary:
Warning, Error and Debug are the 3 doors to send traces This sample shows how to send a sample trace.
TTrace.Error.Send ("Hello", "world") ; // 2 columns TTrace.Warning.Send ("Hello") ; // 1 columns TTrace.Debug.SendObject("MyObject" , this) ; // 1 columns + members tree

member.name: P:TraceTool.WinTrace.Debug
member.summary:
Warning, Error and Debug are the 3 doors to send traces This sample shows how to send a sample trace.
TTrace.Error.Send ("Hello", "world") ; // 2 columns TTrace.Warning.Send ("Hello") ; // 1 columns TTrace.Debug.SendObject("MyObject" , this) ; // 1 columns + members tree

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.DisplayWin
member.summary: Show the window tree

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.SetMultiColumn
member.summary: change the tree to display user defined multiple columns must be called before setting column titles. The first column is the main column

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.SetMultiColumn(System.Int32)
member.summary: change the tree to display user defined multiple columns must be called before setting column titles

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.SetLogFile(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Set the log file.(Path is relative to the viewer). To enabled log on local AND on the viewer call this function twice. To don't use the viewer, set the TTrace.options.SendMode to None.
The Mode can be one of the following : 0, Viewer Log is disabled. 1, Viewer log enabled. No size limit. 2, Viewer log enabled. A new file is create each day (CCYYMMDD is appended to the filename) 3, Local log is disabled 4, Local log enabled. No size limit. 5, Local log enabled. A new file is create each day (CCYYMMDD is appended to the filename).
member.param: Local and viewer site log mode.

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.SetLogFile(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Set the log file.(Path is relative to the viewer). To enabled log on local AND on the viewer call this function twice. To don't use the viewer, set the TTrace.options.SendMode to None.
The Mode can be one of the following : 0, Viewer Log is disabled. 1, Viewer log enabled. No size limit. 2, Viewer log enabled. A new file is create each day (CCYYMMDD is appended to the filename) 3, Local log is disabled 4, Local log enabled. No size limit. 5, Local log enabled. A new file is create each day (CCYYMMDD is appended to the filename).
member.param: Local and viewer site log mode.
Number of lines before starting a new \file (default \: \-1 = unlimited).

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.GetLocalLogFile
member.summary: Return the last local log file. (when mode 4 or 5 is used). Note : Call TTrace.Flush() to ensure traces are saved

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.SetColumnsTitle(System.String)
member.summary: set columns title
member.param: Tab separated columns titles Example : Title1 \t title2

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.SetColumnsWidth(System.String)
member.summary: set columns widths
member.param:
Tab separated columns width. The format for each column is width[:Min[:Max]]
where Min and Max are optional minimum and maximum column width for resizing purpose.
Example : 100:20:80 \t 200:50 \t 100

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.GotoFirstNode
member.summary: Set the focus to the first trace node

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.GotoLastNode
member.summary: Set the focus to the last trace node

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.FindNext(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the focus to the next matching node
member.param: If true search down, else search up

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.GotoBookmark(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the focus to a bookmarked node identified by his position. Bookmarks are checked by the user or with the node.SetBookmark() function

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.ClearBookmark
member.summary: Clear all bookmarks

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.ClearFilter
member.summary: Clear all filters

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.AddFilter(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Add a filter to node. Multiple calls to this function can be done. Call ApplyFilter() to apply filtering
member.param:
Column to apply filter.
In multi column mode the first column start at 0
In normal mode :
col icone = 999
col time = 1
col thread = 2
col traces = 3
col Comment = 4
col members = 998

There is 5 kinds of filters :
Equal = 0
Not equal = 1
contains = 2
Don't contains = 3
(Ignore this filter) = 4 or -1

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.ApplyFilter(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Apply filters after calls to AddFilter().
member.param: If true, use an 'AND' condition for each filters, else use a "OR"
If true, show node that match filter and hide others. If false hide matching node and show others

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.ClearAll
member.summary: Clear all trace for the window tree

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.Close
member.summary: Close the window tree

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.CreateResource(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Plugin API : Create a resource.
member.param:
Resource type. See TraceConst
CST_RES_BUT_RIGHT : Button on right CST_RES_BUT_LEFT : Button on left CST_RES_LABEL_RIGHT : Label on right CST_RES_LABELH_RIGHT : Label on right HyperLink CST_RES_LABEL_LEFT : Label on left CST_RES_LABELH_LEFT : Label on left hyperlink CST_RES_MENU_ACTION : Item menu in the Actions Menu CST_RES_MENU_WINDOW : Item menu in the Windows Menu. Call CreateResource on the main win trace to create this menu item
Width of the resource. Applicable only to button and labels

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.DisableResource(System.Int32)
member.summary: Plugin API : Disable tracetool or user created resources
member.param:
The resource Id ResId: resource id to disable. Tracetool resources :
CST_ACTION_CUT : Cut. Same as copy then delete CST_ACTION_COPY : Copy CST_ACTION_DELETE : Delete selected CST_ACTION_SELECT_ALL : Select all CST_ACTION_RESIZE_COLS : Resize columns CST_ACTION_VIEW_INFO : View trace info CST_ACTION_VIEW_PROP : View properties CST_ACTION_PAUSE : Pause CST_ACTION_SAVE : SaveToFile CST_ACTION_CLEAR_ALL : Clear all CST_ACTION_CLOSE_WIN : Close win CST_ACTION_LABEL_INFO : TracesInfo label CST_ACTION_LABEL_LOGFILE : LabelLogFile label CST_ACTION_VIEW_MAIN : View Main trace CST_ACTION_VIEW_ODS : ODS CST_ACTION_OPEN_XML : XML trace -> Tracetool XML traces CST_ACTION_EVENTLOG : Event log CST_ACTION_TAIL : Tail

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.SetTextResource(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Plugin API : Set the resource text (tracetool or user created resources), specified by his Id

member.name: M:TraceTool.WinTrace.LinkToPlugin(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Plugin API : Attach a winTrace to a plugin. Many winTrace can be attached to a plugin. Note that a plugin don't need to be attached to a WinTrace. The plugin is identified by his internal name (not dll name). When linked, the plugin can receive event (see ITracePlugin).
